intro: Polygala irwinii, commonly known as the Irwin's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes over 700 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, often pale blue or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
